Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CaApoD (C. auratus apolipoprotein D, antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs, fish, animals; UCLL1)

Literature.Author: Wang F, Xiong NX, Ou J, Zhong ZR, Xie Q, Huang JF, Li KX, Huang MZ, Fang ZX, Kuang XY, Qin ZL, Luo SW.2024
Literature.Reference: Int J Biol Macromol. 2024 Aug 20:134898. doi: 10.1016/j.ijbiomac.2024.134898.PubMed
Literature.Title: Immunometabolic interplay in Edwardsiella tarda-infected crucian carp (Carassius auratus) and in vitro identification of the antimicrobial activity of apolipoprotein D (ApoD) by utilization of multiomics analyses.

Sequence Information.Comments: Host expression:induced: highest expression in liver. When exposed to Aeromonas hydrophila, CaApoD expression was sharply increased in immune cells.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (29.67%) toShLysGL=A: 12%. GRAVY: -0.147, mol Wt: 18658.657, mol formula: C839H1367N213O249S5, mol ex coeff: 17060.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: incorporated into pET32 plasmid and expressed in E. coli, IPTG induced, Ni2+ affinity purification.Activity: warning: recombinant fusion protein was found to inhibit the growth and biofilm formation of A. hydrophila and E. tarda. Warning: other bacteria not tested. Est. 8/2024
